WorkItem.Description:
When taking a look at the ObservableObject, I noticed something strange. When calling RaisePropertyChanged, internally the VerifyPropertyName gets called. However, according to the documentation (see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.componentmodel.inotifypropertychanged.propertychanged.aspx), I should be able to call it with null or string.Empty to order the binding system to invalidate all properties of the sender.

I think you should check whether the property name is null or empty and allow that.
